description: Power Road Bridge is being upgraded to make it safer for road users and improve access for cyclists and pedestrians

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["We have replaced the Power Road Bridge which carries the A406 North Circular Road (Gunnersbury Avenue) over the railway. The work finished in spring 2019."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
We replaced the Power Road Bridge as part of our programme to improve London's roads and public spaces.

The bridge, which was built in 1922, had reached the end of its operational life. Not replacing the bridge would mean permanent closures of footway and cycle tracks, lane closures and restrictions on the type or weight of vehicles that use the bridge.
The new structure replacing the existing bridge has been designed to last at least 120 years.
The new bridge has improved footways, lighting and better facilities for cyclists on the western side, making this section of the A406 safer for all users.
Minor works to the underside of the bridge and railway embankments, which may not be visible from street level, are scheduled for summer 2019.

{"template":"carousel","link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"carousel":[{"url":"https://tfl.gov.uk/cdn/static/cms/images/demolition-of-western-section-of-the-bridge-web.gif","alt":"Demolition of the western section of the bridge"},{"url":"https://tfl.gov.uk/cdn/static/cms/images/demolishing-the-western-section-of-the-bridge-web.gif","alt":"Demolishing the western section of the bridge"},{"url":"https://tfl.gov.uk/cdn/static/cms/images/lifting-a-wall-for-the-new-western-section-of-bridge-web.gif","alt":"Lifting a wall for the new western section of the bridge"},{"url":"https://tfl.gov.uk/cdn/static/cms/images/lifting-a-new-beam-for-the-western-section-of-bridge-web.gif","alt":"Lifting a new beam for the western section of the bridge"},{"url":"https://tfl.gov.uk/cdn/static/cms/images/prb-waterproofing.jpg","alt":"Completed western deck and waterproofing"},{"url":"https://tfl.gov.uk/cdn/static/cms/images/prb-beam-lift.jpg","alt":"Placing concrete beams on the eastern deck to support the road over the bridge"}],"wrapped":false}
Because of the nearby A406 Gunnersbury Avenue safety scheme there are still some temporary changes to the road.
Until 27 May 2019 the A406 Gunnersbury Avenue will be reduced to one lane in each direction. Expect delays if driving, especially during morning and evening peak hours.
A temporary 30mph speed restriction is in place between the Chiswick Roundabout and Park Place Drive.
Check live traffic news before you leave to stay up-to-date and avoid disruption to your journey.
The project was done in partnership with Hochtief (UK) Construction , Ramboll and Parsons Brinckerhoff , and Skanska UK .
